intro: Gyrostachys linearis, commonly known as the linear leaf sunflower, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and yellow-orange flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has a deep root system, allowing it to thrive in dry conditions. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Gyrostachys linearis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
